The given Node.js code imports specific functions and classes (i.e., `validate`, `ValidationError`, `enableValidation`, `disableValidation`, and `needValidate`) from a module located at `./validate`. It then exports these entities, making them available for other modules or files to use in the application. Essentially, this code serves as a pass-through for these imports, re-exporting them without any modifications.

Below is a rewritten version of the code:

```javascript
"use strict";

// Import selected entities from the './validate' module
const validateModule = require("./validate");

// Re-export the imported entities
module.exports = {
  validate: validateModule.validate,
  ValidationError: validateModule.ValidationError,
  enableValidation: validateModule.enableValidation,
  disableValidation: validateModule.disableValidation,
  needValidate: validateModule.needValidate
};
```
